Replying to @jpwain 2021-07-07 21:00
@jpwain @slightlylate @Netlify I can help with that: Each deploy (on any branch / deploy preview) gets a unique URL so the specific build can always be addressed. That's the permalink. Deploy previews & branch builds also get a URL which always shows the latest build in that context. Good to share and track.
  • Permalink
  • Twitter
Replying to @slightlylate 2021-07-07 20:56
@slightlylate @Netlify That's fair. Thanks, I'll pass it along to the team and reference this in discussions for future.
  • Permalink
  • Twitter
Replying to @slightlylate 2021-07-07 20:52
@slightlylate @Netlify Ok. Useful feedback. So far the biggest pushback I've seen is people asking for this to be possible to turn off through an option. Which was sensible and was swiftly added. https://t.co/4mrxOwzO5n
  • Permalink
  • Twitter
Replying to @slightlylate 2021-07-07 20:49
@slightlylate @Netlify Eh? This is not present on: - production builds - branch builds - permalinks of any builds. It is on deploy previews on the URL for the head of the PR. And you can turn it off with one click for any site.
  • Permalink
  • Twitter
Replying to @slightlylate 2021-07-07 20:46
@slightlylate @Netlify It's optional. You can disable it in your site admin. It's also only added the deploy preview main URL and not to the permalink URLs for each build.
